result.execSummary:
The defendant Troy Adam Livingston was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event that the defendant is discharged from probation with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent SHALL notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment SHALL be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is to pay court costs.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample. 

Defendant is to comply with any treatment/programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and agent. 

Trempealeau County Case No. 21CF02 is dismissed but read in.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Troy Adam Livingston

defendant.name: Livingston, Troy Adam
defendant.address: 304 South Main Street, Apt B, Medford, WI 54451

records.addlTxt: 3:11 PM DA Sacia appears in person for the state. Defendant appears by phone. Attorney Grabow appears in person. Defendant can hear okay, okay appearing by phone, received no threats/promises to appear by phone. Court finds def KVI waives personal appearance. Joint recommendation presented to the court. State moves to amend count 1. Court grants amendment. Court advised defendant of rights/max penalties. Defendant KVI waives all rights and enters NC plea to amended count 1. Court finds defendant G of amended count 1. Defendant sentenced. Trempealeau County Case No. 21CF02 is dismissed but read in.
